subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Utter/Ado
msgSnippet: I am working on a dictionary, based on a perl script which heuristically doctors the transcriptions of the CMU phonetic dictionary. There will be room for
messageBody:
I am working on a dictionary, based on a perl script which
heuristically doctors the transcriptions of the CMU
phonetic dictionary. There will be room for errors and inde-
terminacies which will have to be checked against the LPD
by hand, but I could release an alpha version with
uncorrected errors.













It so happens that I am doing the same thing right now. I have actually already generated such a dictionary, and it is what I have used to generate the news. However, I am in the process of creating even a more accurate dictionary by checking some online sources. (The CMU dictionary merged Awl and On, whereas the new dictionary will not.)


I have decided to keep Ah-Roe for START and Awe-Roe for NORTH-
FORCE, since these are in fact easier to write than At-Roe
and Ox-Roe.







I agree with this decision. Hasn't it become convention to do so at this point? I know that Read recommends writing words this way.

Paul
